titles.title: A bill to amend the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act to extend the date after which surplus funds in the wildlife restoration fund become available for apportionment.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Inhofe under authority of the order of the Senate of 07/29/2005 without amendment. With written report No. 109-125.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 196.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Renzi moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1340.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/29/2005--Public Law. Amends the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act to extend until September 30, 2016, the date after which unexpended funds in the wildlife restoration fund will become available for apportionment to states.
